Row.Text: "Increased means and increased leisure are the two civilizers of man."
"As my eyes grew accustomed to the light, details of the room emerged. Strange animals, statues, and gold – everywhere the glint of gold."
"They say that "Knowledge is Power." I used to think so; but I now know that they meant "money.""
"War is righteous or unrighteous according as it is opportune or inopportune."
+3 [icon:YIELD_PRODUCTION] Production in Settlements for every [icon:RADIAL_RESOURCES] Factory Resource assigned to them.
[icon:UNIT_ANTIQUARIAN] Antiquaries can enter other Civilizations’ borders without Open Borders.
+3 [icon:NAR_REW_COMBAT] Combat Strength for Units if you have positive or 0 [icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold per turn at the start of the turn.
+1 [icon:RADIAL_RESOURCES] Resource Capacity in Settlements with a Port.
+4 [icon:YIELD_CULTURE] Culture and [icon:YIELD_SCIENCE] Science in [icon:YIELD_CITIES] Cities with both a [icon:NAR_REW_GREATWORK] Great Work and a [icon:RADIAL_RESOURCES] Resource slotted.

+10% [icon:YIELD_FOOD] Food and [icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold in [icon:YIELD_TOWNS] Towns, but -5% [icon:YIELD_GOLD] Gold in the [icon:NOTIFICATION_SELECT_CAPITAL] Capital for every [icon:PLAYER_RELATIONSHIP_ALLIANCE] Alliance.
